training_data1.question: What is IT governance program about?
training_data1.answer: The Management et Gouvernance des Systèmes d'Information program focuses on managing and governing information systems within organizations. It covers IT strategy, system management, governance frameworks, project management, and aligning technology with business objectives.

training_data1.question: Compare computer engineering programs at ENSAKH
training_data1.answer: ENSAKH offers three computing-related engineering programs: Génie Informatique focuses on software and systems, Informatique et Ingénierie des Données specializes in data engineering and analytics, and Management et Gouvernance des Systèmes d'Information concentrates on IT management and governance. Each serves different career paths in the technology sector.

training_data1.question: What is the difference between engineering and master's programs?
training_data1.answer: Engineering programs at ENSAKH are 3-year undergraduate professional degrees leading to the title of engineer. The master's program (Master en Informatique et Mathématiques pour la Science des Données) is a graduate degree focused on advanced research and specialized knowledge in data science, requiring prior completion of an undergraduate degree.

training_data1.question: What industries hire ENSAKH electrical engineering graduates?
training_data1.answer: Electrical engineering graduates from ENSAKH work in power generation and distribution companies, electrical equipment manufacturing, renewable energy sector, telecommunications infrastructure, industrial automation, construction and building services, and consulting firms.

training_data1.question: What industries hire telecommunications graduates?
training_data1.answer: Telecommunications graduates from ENSAKH work in telecom operators, network infrastructure companies, cybersecurity firms, IT consulting, cloud service providers, network equipment manufacturers, and government agencies focused on digital infrastructure and security.

training_data1.question: What industries hire process engineering graduates?
training_data1.answer: Process engineering graduates from ENSAKH work in phosphate processing (given Khouribga's industry), chemical plants, pharmaceutical manufacturing, food processing, energy sector, environmental consulting, waste management, and sustainability initiatives.

training_data1.question: What industries hire data science graduates?
training_data1.answer: Data science graduates from ENSAKH work in technology companies, financial services, e-commerce, telecommunications, healthcare analytics, marketing analytics, consulting firms, research institutions, and any organization leveraging big data and AI.

training_data1.question: Does ENSAKH prepare students for industry certifications?

Contact your department head to inquire about certification preparation in areas like Cisco networking, cloud platforms, project management, or other industry-recognized credentials.

training_data1.question: What is the relationship between ENSAKH and the phosphate industry?
training_data1.answer: ENSAKH is strategically located in Khouribga, Morocco's phosphate capital. This location provides unique opportunities for engineering education related to mineral processing, chemical engineering, industrial automation, and environmental management in the context of phosphate mining and processing industries.

training_data1.question: How does ENSAKH support student success?
training_data1.answer: With 62 faculty members serving 7 programs across 4 departments, ENSAKH maintains quality education through accessible faculty, department leadership, and structured programs. For details about tutoring, academic support, career services, and student resources, contact contact.ensak@usms.ma.

training_data1.question: What makes the data science master's unique?
training_data1.answer: The Master en Informatique et Mathématiques pour la Science des Données is ENSAKH's only graduate program, combining computer science and mathematics for interdisciplinary data science education. It prepares students for advanced careers in AI, machine learning, data analytics, and research.

training_data1.question: What are the key strengths of each department?
training_data1.answer: Mathématiques et Informatique excels with 26 faculty and diverse computing programs; Génie Électrique provides specialized electrical systems education; Génie Réseaux et Télécommunications leads in cybersecurity and intelligent networks; Génie des Procédés leverages Khouribga's industrial context for practical process and energy engineering education.

training_data1.question: What makes ENSAKH a good choice for engineering education?

conversations.question: Who are the department heads at ENSAKH?

faq.question: Who can I talk to about research opportunities at ENSAKH?
faq.answer: Research opportunities at ENSAKH vary by department. Contact the relevant department head: Professor GHAZDALI Abdelghani for computer science and mathematics research, Professor EL BARBRI Noureddine for electrical engineering, Professor MOUNIR Soufyane for networks and telecommunications, or Professor TOUIL Salah for process engineering and environmental research.

faq.question: How do I schedule a meeting with an ENSAKH faculty member?
faq.answer: To schedule a meeting with ENSAKH faculty, email them directly at their @usms.ma address explaining your purpose and availability. Department heads typically handle student meetings and can direct you to the appropriate faculty member if needed. Allow 2-3 business days for a response.

faq.question: What email should I use for internship questions at ENSAKH?
faq.answer: For internship inquiries at ENSAKH, contact your department head as they coordinate industry partnerships and internship placements. Computer science students should contact Professor GHAZDALI Abdelghani at a.ghazdali@usms.ma, while engineering students should reach their respective department heads.

faq.question: Who handles international student inquiries at ENSAKH?
faq.answer: International student inquiries at ENSAKH should be directed to contact.ensak@usms.ma initially. They can provide information about visa requirements, housing, program equivalencies, and French language requirements. Department heads can answer program-specific questions for international applicants.

faq.question: How can I get academic advising at ENSAKH?
faq.answer: Academic advising at ENSAKH is provided by department heads and faculty members. Contact your department head for program planning, course selection, and career guidance. For computer science, email Professor GHAZDALI Abdelghani at a.ghazdali@usms.ma. Other departments have similar advising through their respective heads.

faq.question: I have a question about scholarships. Who do I contact?
faq.answer: Scholarship and financial aid questions at ENSAKH should be directed to contact.ensak@usms.ma. They can provide information about available scholarships, application procedures, and eligibility requirements. Some department-specific scholarships may be coordinated through department heads.

faq.question: Who do I contact about changing my major at ENSAKH?
faq.answer: To change your major at ENSAKH, contact both your current department head and the head of the department you wish to transfer to. They will review your academic record and discuss transfer requirements. Start by emailing your current department head to initiate the process.

faq.question: How do I report a technical issue with ENSAKH facilities?
faq.answer: Technical issues with ENSAKH facilities, laboratories, or equipment should be reported to your department head or the main office at contact.ensak@usms.ma. For computer lab issues in the Mathématiques et Informatique department, contact Professor GHAZDALI Abdelghani at a.ghazdali@usms.ma.

faq.question: Can I get contact information for specific ENSAKH professors?
faq.answer: ENSAKH professors can be reached at their @usms.ma email addresses. For specific contact information, check with your department head or contact the main office at contact.ensak@usms.ma. They can provide current email addresses and office hours for faculty members in your area of interest.

faq.question: Who should I email about graduate programs at ENSAKH?
faq.answer: For graduate program inquiries at ENSAKH, including masters degrees, contact the relevant department head. Professor GHAZDALI Abdelghani handles the Master en Informatiques et Mathématiques pour la science des Données at a.ghazdali@usms.ma. Other departments offer specialized engineering masters through their respective heads.

faq.question: How do I contact ENSAKH about campus visits?
faq.answer: To arrange a campus visit to ENSAKH, email contact.ensak@usms.ma with your preferred dates and areas of interest. They can coordinate tours, department visits, and meetings with faculty. If you want to visit a specific department, you can also contact that department head directly.

faq.question: I need transcript or documentation from ENSAKH. Who handles this?
faq.answer: Official transcripts and documentation requests at ENSAKH should be directed to contact.ensak@usms.ma. They coordinate with the registrar's office for academic records, diplomas, and official certificates. Allow sufficient processing time for document requests, especially for certified copies.

faq.question: Where can I find office hours for ENSAKH professors?
faq.answer: ENSAKH professor office hours vary by individual and semester. Contact your professor directly at their @usms.ma email to ask about their current office hours and availability. Department heads typically post office hours or can be reached by appointment through email.

data.instruction: You are a helpful assistant for ENSAKH (École Nationale des Sciences Appliquées de Khouribga). Answer questions about the school accurately and helpfully.
data.input: What is ENSAKH?
data.output: ENSAKH (École Nationale des Sciences Appliquées de Khouribga) is a prestigious engineering school located in Khouribga, Morocco. It is part of Sultan Moulay Slimane University (USMS) and offers high-quality engineering education across four main departments: Mathematics and Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Networks and Telecommunications Engineering, and Process Engineering.

data.instruction: You are a helpful assistant for ENSAKH (École Nationale des Sciences Appliquées de Khouribga). Answer questions about the school accurately and helpfully.
data.input: How many departments does ENSAKH have?
data.output: ENSAKH has four academic departments: Mathématiques et Informatique (Mathematics and Computer Science), Génie Électrique (Electrical Engineering), Génie Réseaux et Télécommunications (Networks and Telecommunications), and Génie des Procédés (Process Engineering).

data.instruction: You are a helpful assistant for ENSAKH (École Nationale des Sciences Appliquées de Khouribga). Answer questions about the school accurately and helpfully.
data.input: Where is ENSAKH located?
data.output: ENSAKH is located in Khouribga, Morocco, and is part of Sultan Moulay Slimane University (USMS).

data.instruction: You are a helpful assistant for ENSAKH (École Nationale des Sciences Appliquées de Khouribga). Answer questions about the school accurately and helpfully.
data.input: How can I contact ENSAKH?
data.output: You can contact ENSAKH through email at contact.ensak@usms.ma. For specific departments or faculty members, please specify which department you'd like to contact.

data.instruction: You are a helpful assistant for ENSAKH (École Nationale des Sciences Appliquées de Khouribga). Answer questions about the school accurately and helpfully.
data.input: What is the Mathematics and Computer Science department?
data.output: The Mathematics and Computer Science department (Mathématiques et Informatique) is headed by Professor GHAZDALI Abdelghani. The department offers engineering programs in Computer Engineering, Information and Data Engineering, and Management and Governance of Information Systems, as well as a Master's program in Computer Science and Mathematics for Data Science. The department has 26 faculty members with expertise in various areas of mathematics and computer science.

data.instruction: You are a helpful assistant for ENSAKH (École Nationale des Sciences Appliquées de Khouribga). Answer questions about the school accurately and helpfully.
data.input: Who is the head of the Mathematics and Computer Science department?
data.output: The head of the Mathematics and Computer Science department (Mathématiques et Informatique) is Professor GHAZDALI Abdelghani.

data.instruction: You are a helpful assistant for ENSAKH (École Nationale des Sciences Appliquées de Khouribga). Answer questions about the school accurately and helpfully.
data.input: What programs does the Mathematics and Computer Science department offer?
data.output: The Mathematics and Computer Science department offers: Engineering in Computer Science (Génie informatique), Engineering in Information and Data Engineering (Informatique et Ingénierie des données), Engineering in Management and Governance of Information Systems, and a Master's degree in Computer Science and Mathematics for Data Science.

data.instruction: You are a helpful assistant for ENSAKH (École Nationale des Sciences Appliquées de Khouribga). Answer questions about the school accurately and helpfully.
data.input: What is the Electrical Engineering department?
data.output: The Electrical Engineering department (Génie Électrique) is headed by Professor EL BARBRI Noureddine. The department offers an engineering program in Electrical Engineering and has 13 faculty members specializing in various aspects of electrical engineering including power systems, electronics, and automation.

data.instruction: You are a helpful assistant for ENSAKH (École Nationale des Sciences Appliquées de Khouribga). Answer questions about the school accurately and helpfully.
data.input: Who is the head of the Electrical Engineering department?
data.output: The head of the Electrical Engineering department (Génie Électrique) is Professor EL BARBRI Noureddine.

data.instruction: You are a helpful assistant for ENSAKH (École Nationale des Sciences Appliquées de Khouribga). Answer questions about the school accurately and helpfully.
data.input: What is the Networks and Telecommunications department?
data.output: The Networks and Telecommunications department (Génie Réseaux et Télécommunications) is headed by Professor MOUNIR Soufyane, with Professor MALEH Yassin as deputy head. The department offers an engineering program in Intelligent Networks Engineering and Cybersecurity (IRIC) and has 11 faculty members specializing in network security, telecommunications, and cybersecurity.

data.instruction: You are a helpful assistant for ENSAKH (École Nationale des Sciences Appliquées de Khouribga). Answer questions about the school accurately and helpfully.
data.input: Who is the head of the Networks and Telecommunications department?
data.output: The head of the Networks and Telecommunications department (Génie Réseaux et Télécommunications) is Professor MOUNIR Soufyane, with Professor MALEH Yassin as deputy head.

data.instruction: You are a helpful assistant for ENSAKH (École Nationale des Sciences Appliquées de Khouribga). Answer questions about the school accurately and helpfully.
data.input: What is the Process Engineering department?
data.output: The Process Engineering department (Génie des Procédés) is headed by Professor TOUIL Salah, with Professor KHAMAR Lhachmi as deputy head. The department offers an engineering program in Process Engineering, Energy and Environment (GPEE) and has 12 faculty members specializing in chemical processes, energy systems, and environmental engineering.

data.instruction: You are a helpful assistant for ENSAKH (École Nationale des Sciences Appliquées de Khouribga). Answer questions about the school accurately and helpfully.
data.input: What engineering programs are available at ENSAKH?
data.output: ENSAKH offers several engineering programs: Computer Engineering, Information and Data Engineering, Management and Governance of Information Systems, Electrical Engineering, Intelligent Networks Engineering and Cybersecurity (IRIC), and Process Engineering, Energy and Environment (GPEE). There are also Master's programs available in specific fields.

data.instruction: You are a helpful assistant for ENSAKH (École Nationale des Sciences Appliquées de Khouribga). Answer questions about the school accurately and helpfully.
data.input: How many faculty members does ENSAKH have?
data.output: ENSAKH has 62 faculty members across its four departments: 26 in Mathematics and Computer Science, 13 in Electrical Engineering, 11 in Networks and Telecommunications, and 12 in Process Engineering.

data.instruction: You are a helpful assistant for ENSAKH (École Nationale des Sciences Appliquées de Khouribga). Answer questions about the school accurately and helpfully.
data.input: What is the IRIC program?
data.output: IRIC (Ingénierie des Réseaux Intelligents et Cybersécurité) is an engineering program offered by the Networks and Telecommunications department. It focuses on Intelligent Networks Engineering and Cybersecurity, preparing students for careers in network security, telecommunications, and cybersecurity.

data.instruction: You are a helpful assistant for ENSAKH (École Nationale des Sciences Appliquées de Khouribga). Answer questions about the school accurately and helpfully.
data.input: What is the GPEE program?
data.output: GPEE (Génie des Procédés, de l'Energie et de l'Environnement) is an engineering program offered by the Process Engineering department. It focuses on Process Engineering, Energy and Environment, preparing students for careers in chemical processes, energy systems, and environmental engineering.

curated_faqs.instruction: You are a helpful assistant for ENSAKH (École Nationale des Sciences Appliquées de Khouribga). Answer questions about the school accurately and helpfully.
curated_faqs.input: What is ENSAKH?
curated_faqs.output: ENSAKH (École Nationale des Sciences Appliquées de Khouribga) is a prestigious engineering school located in Khouribga, Morocco. It is part of Sultan Moulay Slimane University (USMS) and offers high-quality engineering education across four main departments: Mathematics and Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Networks and Telecommunications Engineering, and Process Engineering.

curated_faqs.instruction: You are a helpful assistant for ENSAKH (École Nationale des Sciences Appliquées de Khouribga). Answer questions about the school accurately and helpfully.
curated_faqs.input: How many departments does ENSAKH have?
curated_faqs.output: ENSAKH has four academic departments: Mathématiques et Informatique (Mathematics and Computer Science), Génie Électrique (Electrical Engineering), Génie Réseaux et Télécommunications (Networks and Telecommunications), and Génie des Procédés (Process Engineering).

curated_faqs.instruction: You are a helpful assistant for ENSAKH (École Nationale des Sciences Appliquées de Khouribga). Answer questions about the school accurately and helpfully.
curated_faqs.input: Where is ENSAKH located?
curated_faqs.output: ENSAKH is located in Khouribga, Morocco, and is part of Sultan Moulay Slimane University (USMS).

curated_faqs.instruction: You are a helpful assistant for ENSAKH (École Nationale des Sciences Appliquées de Khouribga). Answer questions about the school accurately and helpfully.
curated_faqs.input: What is the Mathematics and Computer Science department?
curated_faqs.output: The Mathematics and Computer Science department (Mathématiques et Informatique) is headed by Professor GHAZDALI Abdelghani. The department offers engineering programs in Computer Engineering, Information and Data Engineering, and Management and Governance of Information Systems, as well as a Master's program in Computer Science and Mathematics for Data Science. The department has 26 faculty members with expertise in various areas of mathematics and computer science.

curated_faqs.instruction: You are a helpful assistant for ENSAKH (École Nationale des Sciences Appliquées de Khouribga). Answer questions about the school accurately and helpfully.

curated_faqs.instruction: You are a helpful assistant for ENSAKH (École Nationale des Sciences Appliquées de Khouribga). Answer questions about the school accurately and helpfully.
curated_faqs.input: What programs does the Mathematics and Computer Science department offer?
curated_faqs.output: The Mathematics and Computer Science department offers: Engineering in Computer Science (Génie informatique), Engineering in Information and Data Engineering (Informatique et Ingénierie des données), Engineering in Management and Governance of Information Systems, and a Master's degree in Computer Science and Mathematics for Data Science.

curated_faqs.instruction: You are a helpful assistant for ENSAKH (École Nationale des Sciences Appliquées de Khouribga). Answer questions about the school accurately and helpfully.
curated_faqs.input: What is the Electrical Engineering department?
curated_faqs.output: The Electrical Engineering department (Génie Électrique) is headed by Professor EL BARBRI Noureddine. The department offers an engineering program in Electrical Engineering and has 13 faculty members specializing in various aspects of electrical engineering including power systems, electronics, and automation.

curated_faqs.input: What is the Networks and Telecommunications department?
curated_faqs.output: The Networks and Telecommunications department (Génie Réseaux et Télécommunications) is headed by Professor MOUNIR Soufyane, with Professor MALEH Yassin as deputy head. The department offers an engineering program in Intelligent Networks Engineering and Cybersecurity (IRIC) and has 11 faculty members specializing in network security, telecommunications, and cybersecurity.

curated_faqs.input: What is the Process Engineering department?
curated_faqs.output: The Process Engineering department (Génie des Procédés) is headed by Professor TOUIL Salah, with Professor KHAMAR Lhachmi as deputy head. curated_faqs.instruction: You are a helpful assistant for ENSAKH (École Nationale des Sciences Appliquées de Khouribga). Answer questions about the school accurately and helpfully.
curated_faqs.input: What is the IRIC program?
curated_faqs.output: IRIC (Ingénierie des Réseaux Intelligents et Cybersécurité) is an engineering program offered by the Networks and Telecommunications department. curated_faqs.instruction: You are a helpful assistant for ENSAKH (École Nationale des Sciences Appliquées de Khouribga). Answer questions about the school accurately and helpfully.
curated_faqs.input: What is the GPEE program?
curated_faqs.output: GPEE (Génie des Procédés, de l'Energie et de l'Environnement) is an engineering program offered by the Process Engineering department. It focuses on Process Engineering, Energy and Environment, preparing students for careers in chemical processes, energy systems, and environmental engineering.

qa_pairs.question: Can you tell me about ENSAKH?
qa_pairs.answer: ENSAKH, as part of Sultan Moulay Slimane University, maintains high academic standards and provides students with excellent preparation for engineering careers in Morocco and internationally.

qa_pairs.question: What can you tell me about the computer science and mathematics department at ENSAKH?
qa_pairs.answer: The Mathématiques et Informatique department at ENSAKH is one of Morocco's leading computer science and mathematics programs. Headed by Professor GHAZDALI Abdelghani, the department serves 26 faculty members who are experts in algorithms, artificial intelligence, data science, software engineering, cybersecurity. Students can pursue engineering degrees in Computer Engineering, Information and Data Engineering, Management and Governance of Information Systems, as well as a Master's degree in Computer Science and Mathematics for Data Science. The curriculum combines theoretical foundations with practical applications, preparing graduates for careers in software development, data science, cybersecurity, and research. ENSAKH's strong industry connections ensure students gain real-world experience through internships and collaborative projects with leading technology companies.

qa_pairs.question: What does the electrical engineering department at ENSAKH offer?
qa_pairs.answer: The Génie Électrique department at ENSAKH offers comprehensive electrical engineering education under the leadership of Professor EL BARBRI Noureddine. With 13 experienced faculty members, the department covers power systems, electronics, automation, control systems, renewable energy and related fields. The program emphasizes both theoretical knowledge and hands-on experience through modern laboratories and industry partnerships. Students learn to design and implement electrical systems, work with renewable energy technologies, and develop automation solutions. Graduates typically find employment in energy companies, manufacturing industries, telecommunications, or pursue advanced studies. The department's strong reputation in Morocco makes ENSAKH graduates highly sought after by employers in the electrical engineering sector.

qa_pairs.question: What does ENSAKH offer in networks and telecommunications?
qa_pairs.answer: The Génie Réseaux et Télécommunications department at ENSAKH specializes in cutting-edge network technologies and cybersecurity. Led by Professor MOUNIR Soufyane with Professor MALEH Yassin as deputy head, the department has 11 faculty members who are experts in network security, telecommunications, cybersecurity, wireless networks, IoT. The flagship IRIC program (Intelligent Networks Engineering and Cybersecurity) prepares students for the rapidly evolving digital landscape. Students gain expertise in network design, security protocols, wireless technologies, and Internet of Things applications. With Morocco's growing focus on digital transformation, graduates are in high demand by telecommunications companies, cybersecurity firms, banks, and government agencies. The program includes practical training with industry-standard equipment and certification preparation.

qa_pairs.question: What does the process engineering department at ENSAKH offer?
qa_pairs.answer: The Génie des Procédés department at ENSAKH focuses on sustainable engineering solutions for industry and environment. Under the direction of Professor TOUIL Salah and deputy Professor KHAMAR Lhachmi, the department's 12 faculty members specialize in chemical processes, energy systems, environmental engineering, industrial processes. The GPEE program (Process Engineering, Energy and Environment) addresses critical challenges in industrial processes, renewable energy, and environmental protection. Students learn to design efficient manufacturing processes, develop clean energy solutions, and implement environmental management systems. This interdisciplinary approach prepares graduates for careers in chemical industries, energy companies, environmental consulting, and research institutions. Morocco's industrial development and environmental priorities create excellent career opportunities for GPEE graduates.

qa_pairs.question: How can I get in touch with ENSAKH?
qa_pairs.answer: You can contact ENSAKH through several channels depending on your needs. For general inquiries, admissions information, or administrative matters, email contact.ensak@usms.ma or visit the school's campus in Khouribga or the school website http://ensak.usms.ac.ma/ensak/. Each department also has direct contact options: reach the Mathematics and Computer Science department through Professor GHAZDALI Abdelghani, Electrical Engineering through Professor EL BARBRI Noureddine, Networks and Telecommunications through Professor MOUNIR Soufyane, or Process Engineering through Professor TOUIL Salah. The school's website provides detailed contact information, application procedures, and academic program details. For prospective students, the admissions office can provide guidance on entrance requirements, application deadlines, and program specifics. Current students and faculty can also contact their respective departments directly for academic or administrative support.

qa_pairs.question: Where is ENSAKH located?
qa_pairs.answer: ENSAKH is strategically located in Khouribga, Morocco, a city known for its mining industry and growing technological sector. As part of Sultan Moulay Slimane University, the school benefits from being situated in the Béni Mellal-Khénifra region, which offers both urban amenities and natural beauty. Khouribga's location provides students with access to industrial internships and job opportunities while maintaining a manageable cost of living compared to larger cities like Casablanca or Rabat. The campus features modern facilities, laboratories, and student services designed to support academic excellence. The city's transportation connections make it easily accessible from major Moroccan cities, and the surrounding region offers cultural and recreational opportunities that enhance the student experience during their engineering studies.

metadata7.title: ENSAKH Comprehensive FAQ Training Dataset
metadata7.description: Extended training data with main questions and follow-up responses

faq_responses.main_answer: ENSAKH (École Nationale des Sciences Appliquées de Khouribga) is a prestigious engineering school in Morocco, part of Sultan Moulay Slimane University (USMS). Located in Khouribga, it offers engineering degrees across four main departments: Mathematics and Computer Science (26 faculty), Electrical Engineering (13 faculty), Networks and Telecommunications (11 faculty), and Process Engineering (12 faculty). ENSAKH provides quality technical education preparing students for careers in engineering and technology sectors.

follow_ups.question: What programs does ENSAKH offer?
follow_ups.answer: ENSAKH offers several engineering programs: Computer Engineering (Génie Informatique), Information and Data Engineering (IID), Management and Governance of Information Systems (MGSI), Intelligent Networks and Cybersecurity Engineering (IRIC), Electrical Engineering with two options (Embedded Systems and Renewable Energy & Electric Mobility), and Process Engineering, Energy and Environment (GPEE). Additionally, there's a Master's program in Big Data & Decision Support.

follow_ups.question: Is ENSAKH a good school?
follow_ups.answer: ENSAKH is a recognized engineering school within Morocco's national education system. As part of the ENSA network, it follows standardized curriculum guidelines and quality assurance measures set by the Ministry of Higher Education. The school has 62 faculty members across departments and offers accredited programs. Quality indicators include industry partnerships, modern laboratories, and graduate employment outcomes. I recommend connecting with current students or alumni for firsthand insights.

follow_ups.question: How can I apply to ENSAKH?
follow_ups.answer: Admission to ENSAKH follows the standard Moroccan engineering school process. For first-year entry: complete two years of preparatory classes (CPGE) and take the Concours National Commun (CNC). Your ranking determines admission. Alternative pathways exist for certain programs. For second-year admission (lateral entry): holders of Bachelor's degrees in Mathematics or Computer Science can apply through file review, written test, and oral interview. Contact the school at contact.ensak@usms.ma or visit http://ensak.usms.ac.ma for specific requirements and deadlines.

faq_responses.main_answer: ENSAKH is strategically located in Khouribga, Morocco, a city in the Béni Mellal-Khénifra region, approximately 120 kilometers southeast of Casablanca. The address is Boulevard Béni Amir, BP 77, Khouribga. Khouribga, known historically for phosphate mining, has developed into an educational hub. The location offers students access to industrial internships while maintaining a manageable cost of living compared to larger cities.

follow_ups.question: How do I get to ENSAKH?
follow_ups.answer: Khouribga is accessible by road and rail from major Moroccan cities. From Casablanca: take a train (ONCF) or bus, approximately 2-3 hours. The city is connected to the national highway network. Once in Khouribga, local taxis or buses can take you to campus. For precise campus directions, contact the administration at 0523492335 or 0618534372, or check the website for a campus map.

follow_ups.question: Is Khouribga easy to reach?
follow_ups.answer: Yes, Khouribga is relatively accessible due to its central location. It's served by Morocco's rail network (ONCF) with regular trains from Casablanca, Rabat, and other cities. Road connections are good with buses operating from major cities. The journey from Casablanca takes about 2-3 hours by train or bus. While not as directly connected as larger cities, transportation options are reliable.

follow_ups.question: What's Khouribga like as a city?
follow_ups.answer: Khouribga is a mid-sized city with approximately 200,000 residents. Historically known for phosphate mining, it has a strong industrial character but is developing educational and service sectors. The city has essential student amenities including housing, restaurants, cafes, and shopping. It's less cosmopolitan than Casablanca or Rabat, offering a more focused study environment. The cost of living is generally lower than in larger cities, advantageous for students.

faq_responses.main_question: How many departments does ENSAKH have?
faq_responses.main_answer: ENSAKH has four academic departments: 1) Mathématiques et Informatique (Mathematics and Computer Science) headed by Professor GHAZDALI Abdelghani with 26 faculty members, 2) Génie Électrique (Electrical Engineering) headed by Professor EL BARBRI Noureddine with 13 faculty, 3) Génie Réseaux et Télécommunications (Networks and Telecommunications) headed by Professor MOUNIR Soufyane with 11 faculty, and 4) Génie des Procédés (Process Engineering) headed by Professor TOUIL Salah with 12 faculty. Total: 62 faculty members.

follow_ups.question: Which department is the largest?
follow_ups.answer: The Mathematics and Computer Science department (Mathématiques et Informatique) is the largest with 26 faculty members. This department offers the most programs including Computer Engineering, Information and Data Engineering, Management and Governance of Information Systems, and a Master's in Computer Science and Mathematics for Data Science.

follow_ups.question: What programs does each department offer?
follow_ups.answer: Mathematics & Computer Science: Computer Engineering, Information and Data Engineering (IID), Management and Governance of IS (MGSI), Master in Big Data. Electrical Engineering: Electrical Engineering with two tracks (Embedded Systems, Renewable Energy & Electric Mobility). Networks & Telecommunications: Intelligent Networks and Cybersecurity Engineering (IRIC). Process Engineering: Process Engineering, Energy and Environment (GPEE).

follow_ups.question: How many faculty members are in each department?
follow_ups.answer: Faculty distribution: Mathematics and Computer Science - 26 members, Electrical Engineering - 13 members, Networks and Telecommunications - 11 members, Process Engineering - 12 members. Total across all departments: 62 faculty members providing quality instruction and research supervision.

faq_responses.main_answer: General contact: email contact.ensak@usms.ma, phone 0523492335 or 0618534372, website http://ensak.usms.ac.ma. For specific departments: Mathematics & CS - Professor GHAZDALI Abdelghani (a.ghazdali@usms.ma), Electrical Engineering - Professor EL BARBRI Noureddine (n.elbarbri@usms.ma), Networks & Telecom - Professor MOUNIR Soufyane (s.mounir@usms.ma), Process Engineering - Professor TOUIL Salah (s.touil@usms.ma).

follow_ups.question: Do they have a phone number?
follow_ups.answer: Yes, ENSAKH has two phone numbers: 0523492335 and 0618534372. You can call during business hours for general inquiries, admissions information, or to be directed to specific departments or faculty members.

follow_ups.question: Is there a website I can visit?
follow_ups.answer: Yes, the official ENSAKH website is http://ensak.usms.ac.ma. The website provides detailed information about academic programs, admission procedures, faculty directories, campus facilities, news, and events. You can also find downloadable forms and contact information for different services.

follow_ups.question: What are the office hours?
follow_ups.answer: While specific office hours aren't detailed in the available documents, typical Moroccan university administration hours are Monday-Friday, generally 8:00 AM - 4:00 PM. For precise office hours, I recommend calling 0523492335 or emailing contact.ensak@usms.ma to confirm current schedules, especially during holidays or exam periods.

faq_responses.main_question: Who is the head of the Mathematics and Computer Science department?
faq_responses.main_answer: Professor GHAZDALI Abdelghani is the head of the Mathematics and Computer Science department (Mathématiques et Informatique). He oversees a department with 26 faculty members offering programs in Computer Engineering, Information and Data Engineering, Management and Governance of Information Systems, and a Master's in Computer Science and Mathematics for Data Science. You can contact him at a.ghazdali@usms.ma.

follow_ups.question: How can I contact Professor GHAZDALI?
follow_ups.answer: Professor GHAZDALI Abdelghani can be reached at email: a.ghazdali@usms.ma. As department head, he handles academic inquiries, program information, and administrative matters related to the Mathematics and Computer Science department.

follow_ups.question: What's his email address?
follow_ups.answer: Professor GHAZDALI Abdelghani's email address is a.ghazdali@usms.ma. This is the primary contact for inquiries about Mathematics and Computer Science programs at ENSAKH.

follow_ups.question: What are his research interests?
follow_ups.answer: While specific research interests aren't detailed in the available documents, as head of the Mathematics and Computer Science department overseeing programs in data science, AI, and information systems, his expertise likely encompasses these domains. For detailed information about his research publications and interests, I recommend contacting him directly at a.ghazdali@usms.ma or checking the department's research page.

faq_responses.main_question: What programs does the Mathematics and Computer Science department offer?
faq_responses.main_answer: The Mathematics and Computer Science department offers four main programs: 1) Génie Informatique (Computer Engineering) - general software engineering, 2) Informatique et Ingénierie des Données (IID) - focuses on data engineering, Big Data, AI, and data science, 3) Management et Gouvernance des Systèmes d'Information (MGSI) - IT management and governance, 4) Master en Informatique et Mathématiques pour la Science des Données - graduate program in data science. All programs are 3-year engineering cycles (6 semesters) plus Master (4 semesters).

follow_ups.question: Which program focuses on data science?
follow_ups.answer: Two programs focus on data science: 1) Information and Data Engineering (IID) - undergraduate engineering program covering Machine Learning (S3), AI (S4), Deep Learning (S5), Big Data, and Data Mining. Coordinator: Pr. LAMGHARI Nidal. 2) Master in Computer Science and Mathematics for Data Science - graduate program with modules in data analysis, data mining, deep learning, and Big Data architecture. Coordinator: Pr. HAFIDI Imad. Both prepare students for Data Scientist, Data Engineer, and ML Engineer careers.

follow_ups.question: Is there a cybersecurity program?
follow_ups.answer: Yes, the IRIC (Ingénierie des Réseaux Intelligents et Cybersécurité) program from the Networks and Telecommunications department offers cybersecurity specialization. Students study cryptography, network security, ethical hacking, malware analysis, and forensics. The program offers Cisco (CCNA, CyberOps) and Huawei cybersecurity certifications. Career paths include Pentester, SOC Analyst, Security Auditor, and DevSecOps Engineer.

follow_ups.question: What's the difference between these programs?
follow_ups.answer: Key differences: Génie Informatique (GI) - general software engineering covering full-stack development, databases, DevOps, and software architecture. IID - specializes in data engineering, AI, Big Data, and analytics. MGSI - focuses on IT management, governance, ERP systems, and digital transformation with both technical and business skills. Choose GI for software development careers, IID for data science/AI careers, MGSI for IT management/consulting careers.

faq_responses.main_question: How many faculty members does ENSAKH have?
faq_responses.main_answer: ENSAKH has 62 faculty members distributed across four departments: Mathematics and Computer Science (26 faculty), Electrical Engineering (13 faculty), Networks and Telecommunications (11 faculty), and Process Engineering (12 faculty). Faculty hold positions as Professeur, Professeur Adjoint, or Maître Assistant, with expertise spanning computer science, data science, electrical systems, telecommunications, cybersecurity, and process engineering.

follow_ups.question: What's the student-to-faculty ratio?
follow_ups.answer: While the exact student-to-faculty ratio isn't specified in the documents, with 62 faculty members across four departments and multiple programs, ENSAKH maintains manageable class sizes typical of engineering schools. The Mathematics and Computer Science department, being largest with 26 faculty, handles multiple programs. For specific ratio information, contact the administration at contact.ensak@usms.ma.

follow_ups.question: Which department has the most faculty?
follow_ups.answer: The Mathematics and Computer Science department (Mathématiques et Informatique) has the most faculty with 26 members. This makes sense as it offers the most programs: Computer Engineering, Information and Data Engineering, Management and Governance of IS, and a Master's program. The department is headed by Professor GHAZDALI Abdelghani.

follow_ups.question: Are all faculty members full-time?
follow_ups.answer: The documents indicate faculty members hold academic positions (Professeur, Professeur Adjoint, Maître Assistant), suggesting full-time appointments. However, like many engineering schools, ENSAKH may also have part-time industry professionals teaching specialized courses. For specific information about faculty status and industry partnerships, contact the department heads or administration.

faq_responses.main_answer: IRIC (Ingénierie des Réseaux Intelligents et Cybersécurité) is an engineering program in Intelligent Networks and Cybersecurity offered by the Networks and Telecommunications department. It's a 3-year program (6 semesters) with two specialization tracks in Semester 5: Cybersecurity (ethical hacking, malware analysis, forensics) and Internet of Things (IoT security, emerging communications, blockchain). Students gain certifications from Cisco (CCNA, CyberOps) and Huawei (Cybersecurity, IoT, 5G).

follow_ups.question: What will I learn in IRIC?
follow_ups.answer: IRIC curriculum: S1 - Network architecture, system administration, cryptography, databases. S2 - Cryptography, advanced networks, signal processing. S3 - System/network security, network programming, mobile development, AI fundamentals. S4 - Virtualization, cloud, web security, automation. S5 (Cybersecurity track) - Ethical hacking, AI for cybersecurity, governance, malware/forensics. S5 (IoT track) - AI for IoT, radio engineering, blockchain, IoT security. Programming in C/C++, Python, JavaScript, PowerShell.

follow_ups.question: What jobs can I get after IRIC?
follow_ups.answer: IRIC graduates pursue careers as: Pentester, SOC Analyst, DevSecOps Engineer, Cloud Consultant, IoT Engineer, IT Auditor, Forensics Analyst, Information Systems Security Manager, Network Engineer, and Cybersecurity Consultant. Sectors recruiting include consulting firms, cybersecurity companies, banks, insurance, telecommunications, IT services (SS2I), and industries requiring robust security infrastructure.

follow_ups.question: Is IRIC focused more on networks or security?
follow_ups.answer: IRIC balances both. Years 1-2 build foundations in networks, protocols, and systems. Year 3 offers specialization: choose Cybersecurity track for offensive/defensive security, penetration testing, malware analysis, and forensics, OR IoT track for connected devices, emerging communications, and IoT security. Both tracks cover network security fundamentals. If pure cybersecurity is your goal, choose the Cybersecurity track in S5.

additional_training_examples.user: I want to work in cybersecurity. Should I choose GI, IID, or IRIC?
additional_training_examples.assistant: For cybersecurity, IRIC (Intelligent Networks and Cybersecurity Engineering) is your best choice. It's specifically designed for cybersecurity careers with modules in ethical hacking, penetration testing, malware analysis, forensics, and security governance. You'll also get Cisco and Huawei cybersecurity certifications. GI (Computer Engineering) covers some security (DevSecOps, cloud security) but focuses more on software development. IID (Information and Data Engineering) is primarily for data science and AI. Choose IRIC for dedicated cybersecurity training leading to roles like Pentester, SOC Analyst, or Security Manager.

additional_training_examples.user: I have a Bachelor's in Physics. Can I apply to ENSAKH's Master program?
additional_training_examples.assistant: For the Master in Big Data & Decision Support, admission requires a Bachelor's degree in Mathematics or Computer Science, or an engineering diploma. A Physics degree alone may not meet the requirements unless it includes substantial mathematics and programming coursework. I recommend: 1) Contact Pr. HAFIDI Imad (coordinator) to discuss your specific background, 2) Consider applying to engineering programs if you've completed preparatory classes, 3) Strengthen your profile with relevant coursework or certifications in programming and statistics. Contact: Master coordinator - Pr. HAFIDI Imad, General info - contact.ensak@usms.ma.

additional_training_examples.user: What's the average salary for ENSAKH graduates?
additional_training_examples.assistant: While specific salary data isn't provided in the documents, ENSAKH graduates enter diverse high-demand fields. Typical entry positions: Software Engineers, Data Scientists, Network Engineers, Process Engineers, IT Consultants. Salaries vary by sector (tech companies, consulting, industry, banking) and location (Casablanca, Rabat vs smaller cities). Morocco's engineering salary ranges typically start 8,000-15,000 MAD/month for entry-level, increasing with experience. For current placement statistics and salary information, contact the administration at contact.ensak@usms.ma or 0523492335. Alumni networks can provide real-world insights.

additional_training_examples.user: What programming languages will I learn in the Computer Engineering program?
additional_training_examples.assistant: In Génie Informatique (Computer Engineering), you'll learn: C++ (S1 - Object-Oriented Programming), Java (S2) and Jakarta EE (S3), JavaScript (S4 - including Angular, React frameworks), PHP (with Symfony, CakePHP), Python (prerequisite, used throughout). Additional technologies: MySQL, Oracle, NoSQL databases, Docker, Kubernetes, DevOps tools, UML modeling, Git. By graduation, you'll be proficient in 5+ languages with full-stack development capabilities covering front-end, back-end, databases, and deployment. Coordinator: Pr. SOUSSI Nassima (n.soussi@usms.ma).

qa_dataset5.question: Quelles sont les deux options proposées en Génie Électrique ?
qa_dataset5.answer: Les deux options sont : 1) Systèmes Embarqués, et 2) Énergie Renouvelable et Mobilité Électrique.

qa_dataset5.question: Quels modules sont enseignés au Semestre 1 de la première année ?
qa_dataset5.answer: Électronique Analogique, Électronique Numérique, Programmation Shell sous Unix/Linux, Traitement de Signal, Électrotechnique, Recherche Opérationnelle et Optimisation, et Langues Étrangères S1.

qa_dataset5.question: Liste les modules du Semestre 2 en première année.
qa_dataset5.answer: Informatique Industrielle, Automatique des Systèmes Continus et Discrets, Gestion de la Production et de la maintenance Industrielle, Électronique de puissance 1, Automatisme et API, Culture and Art Skills, et Langues Étrangères S2.

qa_dataset5.question: Quels sont les modules du Semestre 3 pour l'option Systèmes Embarqués ?
qa_dataset5.answer: Régulation Industrielle Avancée, Conception Microélectronique, Microondes/Réseaux et protocoles, Capteurs et Programmation Instrumentale, Machines Électriques, Power Skills: Intelligence Artificielle, et Langues Étrangères S3.

qa_dataset5.question: Décris le contenu du Semestre 4 pour l'option Systèmes Embarqués.
qa_dataset5.answer: Électronique des Systèmes Embarqués, Système sur Puce Microprocesseur, Entrepreneuriat et Management de Projet, Technologies Innovantes pour l'Automobile/Réseaux Industriels, Installations et Sécurité Électriques, Mécatronique, Langues Étrangères S4, et Stage.

qa_dataset5.question: Quels modules sont proposés au Semestre 5 option Systèmes Embarqués ?
qa_dataset5.answer: Systèmes Temps Réel/Soft Embarqué, CEM/Nouveaux Moyens de Transport, Conception Avancée des Circuits Analogiques, Sécurité des Systèmes Embarqués/Traitement Numérique d'Information, Applications Avancées des Réseaux de Neurones Artificiels & Deep Learning, Développement Personnel, et Langues Étrangères S5.

qa_dataset5.question: Quels sont les modules du Semestre 3 pour l'option Énergie Renouvelable ?
qa_dataset5.answer: Régulation Industrielle Avancée, Conception Microélectronique, Microondes/Réseaux et protocoles, Capteurs et Programmation Instrumentale, Machines Électriques, Power Skills: Intelligence Artificielle, et Langues Étrangères S3.

qa_dataset5.question: Liste les modules du Semestre 4 option Énergie Renouvelable et Mobilité Électrique.
qa_dataset5.answer: Commande de Machine 1, Mobilité Électrique, Entrepreneuriat et Management de Projet, Énergie Renouvelable, Installations et Sécurité Électriques, Électronique de Puissance 2, Langues Étrangères S4, et Stage.

qa_dataset5.question: Quels modules sont enseignés au Semestre 5 option Énergie Renouvelable ?
qa_dataset5.answer: Stockage d'Énergie et Recharge Rapide des Batteries, Load Flow & Smart Grid, Développement Personnel, Commande des Machines Électriques 2, Applications Avancées des Réseaux de Neurones Artificiels & Deep Learning, Audit & Efficacité Énergétique, et Langues Étrangères S5.

qa_dataset5.question: Que font les étudiants au Semestre 6 ?
qa_dataset5.answer: Le Semestre 6 est consacré au Projet de Fin d'Étude (PFE) d'une durée de 4 à 6 mois, pour les deux options.

qa_dataset5.question: Quel est l'objectif de la filière Génie Électrique ?
qa_dataset5.answer: Former des ingénieurs de haut niveau possédant les connaissances techniques et méthodologiques pour conduire et améliorer les performances des unités industrielles, concevoir et piloter des systèmes complexes liés à la microélectronique, compatibilité électromagnétique, systèmes embarqués, automatique, régulation, automobile, énergies renouvelables, mobilité électrique, électrotechnique, électronique de puissance et intelligence artificielle.

qa_dataset5.question: Quelles compétences les étudiants acquièrent-ils en Génie Électrique ?
qa_dataset5.answer: Les connaissances scientifiques et techniques pour résoudre les problèmes industriels du génie électrique et énergies renouvelables, une bonne faculté d'adaptation à l'évolution des techniques, et une bonne maîtrise des techniques de conception et programmation des systèmes embarqués.

qa_dataset5.question: Quels sont les débouchés professionnels en Génie Électrique ?
qa_dataset5.answer: Le développement des systèmes embarqués, l'industrie automobile et aéronautique, l'automatisation et régulation industrielle, la commande des procédés, la maintenance industrielle, les bureaux d'étude, les énergies renouvelables, et la mobilité électrique.

qa_dataset5.question: Qui peut accéder en première année de Génie Électrique ?
qa_dataset5.answer: Les candidats ayant validé les deux années préparatoires intégrées, ceux ayant réussi le concours national commun, et les titulaires de DEUG, DUT, DEUST, DEUP ou Licence, dans la limite des places disponibles.

qa_dataset5.question: Quelles sont les conditions d'accès en deuxième année ?
qa_dataset5.answer: Les étudiants ayant validé la 1ère année du cycle ingénieur, ou les titulaires d'un Master en sciences et techniques, Master spécialisé ou équivalent, ou Maîtrise en sciences et techniques ou équivalent.

qa_dataset5.question: Quelle est la procédure de sélection pour la première année ?
qa_dataset5.answer: Étude du dossier.

qa_dataset5.question: Quelle est la procédure de sélection pour la deuxième année ?
qa_dataset5.answer: Étude du dossier suivie d'un examen écrit.

qa_dataset5.question: Quelle est la différence principale entre les deux options au Semestre 4 ?
qa_dataset5.answer: L'option Systèmes Embarqués se concentre sur l'électronique embarquée, système sur puce, technologies automobiles et mécatronique, tandis que l'option Énergie Renouvelable se focalise sur la commande de machines, mobilité électrique, énergies renouvelables et électronique de puissance avancée.

qa_dataset5.question: Qu'est-ce que le module 'Power Skills: Intelligence Artificielle' ?
qa_dataset5.answer: C'est un module transversal enseigné au Semestre 3 pour les deux options, introduisant les compétences en intelligence artificielle appliquées au génie électrique.

qa_dataset5.question: Y a-t-il un stage obligatoire dans le cursus ?
qa_dataset5.answer: Oui, un stage est prévu au Semestre 4 pour les deux options, en plus du PFE au Semestre 6.

qa_dataset5.question: Combien de modules de langues étrangères sont prévus ?
qa_dataset5.answer: 5 modules de langues étrangères, un par semestre du S1 au S5.

qa_dataset5.question: Qu'est-ce que la CEM mentionnée au Semestre 5 ?
qa_dataset5.answer: CEM signifie Compatibilité ÉlectroMagnétique, un module important pour la conception de systèmes embarqués.

qa_dataset5.question: Quel module couvre les aspects entrepreneuriaux ?
qa_dataset5.answer: Le module 'Entrepreneuriat et Management de Projet' enseigné au Semestre 4 pour les deux options.

qa_dataset5.question: Qu'est-ce que le Smart Grid enseigné en S5 ?
qa_dataset5.answer: Le Smart Grid (réseau intelligent) est enseigné dans le module 'Load Flow & Smart Grid' pour l'option Énergie Renouvelable, couvrant la gestion intelligente des réseaux électriques.

qa_dataset5.question: Les deux options partagent-elles des modules communs ?
qa_dataset5.answer: Oui, en première année tous les modules sont communs, et au Semestre 3 les deux options partagent les mêmes modules. La spécialisation commence vraiment aux Semestres 4 et 5.

qa_dataset5.question: Qu'est-ce que la Mécatronique ?
qa_dataset5.answer: La Mécatronique est un module du S4 option Systèmes Embarqués qui combine mécanique, électronique et informatique pour concevoir des systèmes automatisés intelligents.

qa_dataset5.question: Quel module traite de la sécurité électrique ?
qa_dataset5.answer: Le module 'Installations et Sécurité Électriques' au Semestre 4 pour les deux options.

qa_dataset5.question: Qu'apprend-on sur les API en première année ?
qa_dataset5.answer: Le module 'Automatisme et API' au Semestre 2 enseigne la programmation des Automates Programmables Industriels.

qa_dataset5.question: Y a-t-il des modules sur le Deep Learning ?
qa_dataset5.answer: Oui, 'Applications Avancées des Réseaux de Neurones Artificiels & Deep Learning' au Semestre 5 pour les deux options.

qa_dataset5.question: Quelle option est plus adaptée pour travailler dans l'automobile ?
qa_dataset5.answer: L'option Systèmes Embarqués avec le module 'Technologies Innovantes pour l'Automobile' au S4, bien que la mobilité électrique soit aussi couverte dans l'autre option.

qa_dataset5.question: Qu'est-ce que le module 'Soft Embarqué' ?
qa_dataset5.answer: C'est la partie logicielle des systèmes embarqués enseignée dans 'Systèmes Temps Réel/Soft Embarqué' au S5, couvrant la programmation temps réel.

qa_dataset5.question: Quel module traite du stockage d'énergie ?
qa_dataset5.answer: Le module 'Stockage d'Énergie et Recharge Rapide des Batteries' au S5 option Énergie Renouvelable.

qa_dataset5.question: Comment la formation prépare-t-elle aux véhicules électriques ?
qa_dataset5.answer: Par plusieurs modules : Mobilité Électrique (S4), Commande de Machine (S4), Stockage d'Énergie et Recharge Rapide (S5), et Commande des Machines Électriques 2 (S5) dans l'option Énergie Renouvelable.

qa_dataset5.question: Qu'est-ce que l'Audit Énergétique au S5 ?
qa_dataset5.answer: C'est un module 'Audit & Efficacité Énergétique' qui enseigne comment évaluer et optimiser la consommation énergétique des installations industrielles.

qa_dataset5.question: Quels sont les modules de développement personnel ?
qa_dataset5.answer: Il y a 'Culture and Art Skills' au S2 et 'Développement Personnel' au S5.

qa_dataset5.question: La formation couvre-t-elle les microprocesseurs ?
qa_dataset5.answer: Oui, avec le module 'Système sur Puce, Microprocesseur' au S4 option Systèmes Embarqués.

qa_dataset5.question: Qu'apprend-on en Électronique de Puissance ?
qa_dataset5.answer: Il y a deux niveaux : 'Électronique de puissance 1' au S2 (bases), et 'Électronique de Puissance 2' au S4 option Énergie Renouvelable (niveau avancé).

qa_dataset5.question: Quel est le focus de l'option Systèmes Embarqués au S5 ?
qa_dataset5.answer: Le S5 se concentre sur les aspects avancés : temps réel, CEM, nouveaux moyens de transport, conception de circuits analogiques avancés, sécurité et traitement numérique.

qa_dataset5.question: Comment les réseaux industriels sont-ils couverts ?
qa_dataset5.answer: Par les modules 'Microondes/Réseaux et protocoles' (S3) et 'Technologies Innovantes pour l'Automobile/Réseaux Industriels' (S4) option Systèmes Embarqués.

qa_dataset5.question: La formation aborde-t-elle les énergies solaire et éolienne ?
qa_dataset5.answer: Oui, dans le module 'Énergie Renouvelable' au S4 option Énergie Renouvelable et Mobilité Électrique.

qa_dataset5.question: Qu'est-ce que la Régulation Industrielle Avancée ?
qa_dataset5.answer: C'est un module du S3 qui approfondit les techniques de régulation et contrôle automatique des processus industriels.

qa_dataset5.question: Les capteurs sont-ils étudiés dans le programme ?
qa_dataset5.answer: Oui, dans le module 'Capteurs et Programmation Instrumentale' au Semestre 3.

qa_dataset5.question: Quelle est la durée totale de la formation après le préparatoire ?
qa_dataset5.answer: 3 ans (6 semestres) après les 2 années préparatoires, soit 5 ans au total après le bac.

qa_dataset5.question: Y a-t-il une formation en gestion de production ?
qa_dataset5.answer: Oui, le module 'Gestion de la Production et de la maintenance Industrielle' au Semestre 2.

qa_dataset5.question: Comment Unix/Linux est intégré dans la formation ?
qa_dataset5.answer: Par le module 'Programmation Shell sous Unix/Linux' au Semestre 1, enseignant l'automatisation et l'administration système.

qa_dataset5.question: Quelle est la différence entre Automatique et Automatisme ?
qa_dataset5.answer: L'Automatique (S2) traite de la théorie des systèmes continus et discrets, tandis que l'Automatisme et API (S2) se concentre sur la programmation pratique des automates industriels.

qa_dataset5.question: La conception de circuits est-elle enseignée ?
qa_dataset5.answer: Oui, avec 'Conception Microélectronique' (S3) et 'Conception Avancée des Circuits Analogiques' (S5) option Systèmes Embarqués.

qa_dataset5.question: Peut-on se spécialiser dans l'aéronautique avec cette filière ?
qa_dataset5.answer: Oui, l'industrie aéronautique est explicitement mentionnée comme débouché, surtout avec l'option Systèmes Embarqués.

qa_dataset5.question: Qu'est-ce que le Traitement Numérique d'Information ?
qa_dataset5.answer: C'est une partie du module 'Sécurité des Systèmes Embarqués/Traitement Numérique d'Information' au S5, traitant du traitement des signaux numériques dans les systèmes embarqués.

qa_dataset5.question: Qui est le coordinateur de la filière Génie Électrique ?
qa_dataset5.answer: Pr. AMHARECH Amine, joignable à a.amharech@usms.ma

conversational_pairs9.user: Je veux travailler dans les voitures électriques, quelle option choisir ?
conversational_pairs9.assistant: L'option Énergie Renouvelable et Mobilité Électrique est parfaite pour vous ! Elle couvre spécifiquement la Mobilité Électrique (S4), le Stockage d'Énergie et Recharge Rapide des Batteries (S5), et la Commande des Machines Électriques. Vous apprendrez tout sur la propulsion électrique, les batteries et les systèmes de gestion d'énergie pour véhicules électriques.

conversational_pairs9.user: L'option Systèmes Embarqués prépare-t-elle à l'industrie automobile ?
conversational_pairs9.assistant: Absolument ! L'option Systèmes Embarqués est excellente pour l'automobile avec des modules comme 'Technologies Innovantes pour l'Automobile' (S4), 'Mécatronique' (S4), et 'CEM/Nouveaux Moyens de Transport' (S5). L'industrie automobile et aéronautique est d'ailleurs listée comme débouché principal. Vous y apprendrez à concevoir les systèmes électroniques embarqués dans les véhicules modernes.

conversational_pairs9.user: Y a-t-il des modules sur les énergies solaire et éolienne ?
conversational_pairs9.assistant: Oui ! Dans l'option Énergie Renouvelable et Mobilité Électrique, vous avez le module 'Énergie Renouvelable' au Semestre 4 qui couvre les différentes sources d'énergies renouvelables incluant le solaire et l'éolien. Vous étudierez aussi le Smart Grid au S5 pour intégrer ces énergies dans les réseaux électriques.

conversational_pairs9.user: Combien de temps dure le Projet de Fin d'Études ?
conversational_pairs9.assistant: Le PFE dure entre 4 et 6 mois et occupe tout le Semestre 6 (dernière année). C'est l'occasion de travailler sur un projet réel en entreprise et de mettre en pratique toutes vos compétences acquises durant la formation.

conversational_pairs9.user: Peut-on intégrer avec un DUT en électronique ?
conversational_pairs9.assistant: Oui ! Les titulaires de DUT peuvent accéder à la première année du cycle ingénieur, dans la limite des places disponibles. La sélection se fait par étude du dossier. Vous pouvez également intégrer la deuxième année si vous avez un niveau Master ou Maîtrise en sciences et techniques.

conversational_pairs9.user: Est-ce qu'on apprend l'intelligence artificielle en Génie Électrique ?
conversational_pairs9.assistant: Oui ! Il y a le module 'Power Skills: Intelligence Artificielle' au Semestre 3 pour les deux options, puis au Semestre 5 vous avez 'Applications Avancées des Réseaux de Neurones Artificiels & Deep Learning'. L'IA devient de plus en plus importante en génie électrique pour l'optimisation des systèmes et la maintenance prédictive.
